title: Create core parser module
description:
Create src/parser/xlsx_parser.py with:
- Data classes (Statement, Prediction, Outcome, GameData)
- Utility functions for detecting year/structure
- Normalizing participant names (Boof/Bruce, Gael/Gaël variants)
- Parsing outcomes (handle 0/1/NaN/"-" variations to Optional[bool])
- Validating probability values (0.0-1.0 range)

Part of Phase 2: Data Extraction
close_reason: All components completed: data classes, detect_structure, normalize_participant_name, parse_outcome, validate_probability

title: Create extract_predictions_2025 function
description:
Implement function to extract predictions from 2025 format:
- Iterate through participant sheets (exclude Statements, Summary)
- Extract participant name from sheet name
- Match predictions to statements by text (no ID in individual sheets)
- Read Probability column
- Create Prediction objects
- Validate probabilities in [0.0, 1.0]
- Validate statement text matching is successful

title: Implement year-agnostic parser
description:
Create parse_xlsx_file(filepath) function that:
- Auto-detects structure (check for "Main" vs "Statements" sheet)
- Routes to appropriate extraction functions
- Returns GameData object for that year
- Handles errors gracefully

Part of Phase 2: Data Extraction
close_reason: Implemented parse_xlsx_file and extract_outcomes functions. Parser successfully handles multiple file format variations and validates data quality.

title: Create participant name normalization utility
description:
Create utility function to normalize participant names:
- Handle Bruce/Boof as same person
- Handle Gaël/Gael encoding variations
- Handle Christine/Chris as same person
- Maintain consistency within and across years

title: Implement prediction validation
description:
Create validation for predictions:
- All statement_id references exist in statements
- All probabilities in valid range [0.0, 1.0]
- No duplicate predictions (same participant, same statement)
- All participants made predictions for all statements in their year

title: Implement statement extraction
description:
Implement functions for extracting statements from both formats:
- extract_statements_2022_2024(filepath, year): Read Main sheet, extract ID/Prediction/Category/Proposer, parse Outcome column
- extract_statements_2025(filepath, year): Read Statements sheet, extract Number→id/Name→proposer/Prediction/Category, parse Outcome column
- Handle NaN → None and "-" → None for Optional[bool]
- Validate all required fields present and IDs are unique

Part of Phase 2: Data Extraction
close_reason: All statement extraction functions completed: extract_statements_2022_2024 and extract_statements_2025

title: Create probability validation utility
description:
Create utility function to validate probability values:
- Ensure values are in range [0.0, 1.0]
- Handle edge cases and invalid data
- Provide clear error messages

title: Write comprehensive pytest tests
description:
Create test file tests/test_xlsx_parser.py with comprehensive tests for:
- Statement extraction for each year format (2022-2024 vs 2025)
- Prediction extraction for each year format
- Outcome parsing for all formats (0/1/NaN/"-" to Optional[bool])
- Participant name normalization
- Multi-year aggregation
- JSON export/import round-trip
- Test fixtures with sample xlsx files

Part of Phase 1: Test-Driven Development Setup
close_reason: Completed comprehensive pytest test suite following TDD approach. Created test fixtures, test directory structure, and comprehensive tests covering all required functionality.

title: Implement --validate-only mode
description:
Add validation-only mode to CLI:
- Add --validate-only flag
- Run parser and validation without export
- Report validation results
- Exit with appropriate status codes

title: Phase 2: Data Extraction
description: Create core parser module and implement extraction logic for statements, predictions, and multi-year aggregation.

title: Phase 1: Test-Driven Development Setup
description: Write comprehensive pytest tests (TDD approach) that will initially fail but should pass when the plan is complete.

title: Implement cross-year validation
description:
Create validation for cross-year consistency:
- Participant names are consistent across years
- Category names are consistent across years
- No conflicts in data between years

title: Add comprehensive validation
description:
Implement validation for:
- Statements: no duplicate IDs within same year, all required fields present, category values consistent, proposer names normalized
- Predictions: all statement IDs exist, probabilities in valid range, no duplicate predictions, all participants made predictions for all statements
- Cross-year: participant name consistency, category name consistency

Part of Phase 3: Data Validation & Quality
close_reason: Implemented comprehensive validation framework with statement, prediction, and cross-year validation

title: Add data quality reporting
description:
Create generate_summary_report(game_data) function that reports:
- Count statements per year
- Count predictions per year
- List participants per year
- Report missing predictions (if any)
- Report data quality issues

Part of Phase 3: Data Validation & Quality

title: Phase 5: Documentation
description: Add docstrings, README sections, and usage examples.

title: Create year/structure detection utility
description:
Create utility function to detect year format:
- Check for "Main" sheet (2022-2024) vs "Statements" sheet (2025)
- Detect column naming variations
- Return structure type for routing to appropriate extraction functions

title: Add documentation
description:
Complete documentation:
- Add docstrings to all functions
- Create README section on data parsing
- Document data structure and JSON format
- Add examples of common queries on parsed data

Part of Phase 5: Documentation

title: Phase 3: Data Validation & Quality
description: Add comprehensive validation and data quality reporting.

title: Define data classes
description:
Define dataclasses in src/parser/xlsx_parser.py:
- Statement (id, year, text, category, proposer)
- Prediction (statement_id, participant, probability)
- Outcome (statement_id, outcome as Optional[bool], date)
- GameData (statements, predictions, outcomes)

title: Create extract_predictions_2022_2024 function
description:
Implement function to extract predictions from 2022-2024 format:
- Iterate through participant sheets (exclude Main, Summary, Scores)
- Extract participant name from sheet name
- Read ID and Probability columns
- Create Prediction objects for each row
- Normalize participant names
- Validate probabilities in [0.0, 1.0]
- Validate IDs match statements

title: Implement multi-year aggregation
description:
Create parse_all_years(input_dir) function that:
- Finds all .xlsx files in directory
- Parses each file using parse_xlsx_file
- Merges into single GameData object
- Validates no duplicate statement IDs within same year
- Handles participants who didn't play in all years

Part of Phase 2: Data Extraction
close_reason: Implemented parse_all_years function that aggregates all xlsx files in a directory, validates uniqueness, and handles errors gracefully

title: Implement basic CLI structure with Click
description:
Create basic CLI script structure:
- Set up Click application
- Define main command group
- Add --input and --output options
- Add --verbose option for detailed logging
- Set up basic error handling

title: Create CLI script
description:
Create CLI using Click with options:
- --input: Input directory (default: input/)
- --output: Output JSON file (default: data/predictions.json)
- --validate-only: Run validation without exporting
- --summary: Print summary report
- --verbose: Detailed logging

Example usage:
  uv run python parse_data.py --input input/ --output data/predictions.json
  uv run python parse_data.py --input input/ --validate-only
  uv run python parse_data.py --input input/ --summary

Part of Phase 4: Output & CLI

title: Phase 4: Output & CLI
description: Implement data export to JSON and create CLI script.

title: Create extract_statements_2025 function
description:
Implement function to extract statements from 2025 format:
- Read "Statements" sheet from Excel file
- Extract columns: Number→id, Name→proposer, Prediction, Category
- Parse Outcome column (0/1/"-" → False/True/None)
- Validate all required fields present
- Validate IDs are unique within the year

title: Implement statement validation
description:
Create validation for statements:
- No duplicate IDs within same year
- All required fields present (id, year, text, category, proposer)
- Category values are consistent across statements
- Proposer names are normalized correctly

title: Implement --summary mode
description:
Add summary reporting mode to CLI:
- Add --summary flag
- Generate and print summary report
- Display statistics (statements per year, predictions per year, participants)
- Make output human-readable

title: Create extract_statements_2022_2024 function
description:
Implement function to extract statements from 2022-2024 format:
- Read "Main" sheet from Excel file
- Extract columns: ID, Prediction, Category, Proposer
- Parse Outcome column (0/1/NaN → False/True/None)
- Validate all required fields present
- Validate IDs are unique within the year

title: Implement data export
description:
Create export_to_json(game_data, output_path) function that:
- Converts dataclasses to JSON-serializable dicts
- Writes formatted JSON (indent=2 for readability)
- Includes metadata (export timestamp, parser version)

Part of Phase 4: Output & CLI

title: Implement prediction extraction
description:
Implement functions for extracting predictions from both formats:
- extract_predictions_2022_2024(filepath, year): Read participant sheets, extract ID and Probability, normalize participant names
- extract_predictions_2025(filepath, year): Read participant sheets, match predictions to statements by text, extract Probability
- Validate probabilities in [0.0, 1.0] and IDs/text matches statements
- Handle participant name variations across years

Part of Phase 2: Data Extraction
close_reason: All prediction extraction functions completed: extract_predictions_2022_2024 and extract_predictions_2025

title: Create outcome parsing utility
description:
Create utility function to parse outcomes to Optional[bool]:
- 2022-2024 format: 0 → False, 1 → True, NaN → None
- 2025 format: 0 → False, 1 → True, "-" → None
- Return consistent Optional[bool] type
